verses.verse: There was a man<WH376> in the land<WH776> of Uz<WH5780>, whose name<WH8034> was Job<WH347>; and that man<WH376> was perfect<WH8535> and upright<WH3477>, and one that feared<WH3373> God<WH430>, and eschewed<WH5493> evil<WH7451>.
And there were born<WH3205> unto him seven<WH7651> sons<WH1121> and three<WH7969> daughters<WH1323>.

His substance<WH4735> also was seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> sheep<WH6629>, and three<WH7969> thousand<WH505> camels<WH1581>, and five<WH2568> hundred<WH3967> yoke<WH6776> of oxen<WH1241>, and five<WH2568> hundred<WH3967> she asses<WH860>, and a very<WH3966> great<WH7227> household<WH5657>; so that this man<WH376> was the greatest<WH1419> of all the men<WH1121> of the east<WH6924>. substance: or, cattle household: or, husbandry men: Heb. sons

And his sons<WH1121> went<WH1980> and feasted<WH4960> <WH6213> in their houses<WH1004>, every one<WH376> his day<WH3117>; and sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> for their three<WH7969> sisters<WH269> to eat<WH398> and to drink<WH8354> with them.

And it was so, when the days<WH3117> of their feasting<WH4960> were gone about<WH5362>, that Job<WH347> sent<WH7971> and sanctified<WH6942> them, and rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and offered<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930> according to the number<WH4557> of them all: for Job<WH347> said<WH559>, It may be<WH194> that my sons<WH1121> have sinned<WH2398>, and cursed<WH1288> God<WH430> in their hearts<WH3824>. Thus did<WH6213> Job<WH347> continually<WH3117>. continually: Heb. all the days

Now there was a day<WH3117> when the sons<WH1121> of God<WH430> came<WH935> to present<WH3320> themselves before the LORD<WH3068>, and Satan<WH7854> came<WH935> also among<WH8432> them. Satan: Heb. the adversary among: Heb. in the midst of

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Satan<WH7854>, Whence<WH370> comest<WH935> thou? Then Satan<WH7854> answered<WH6030> the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, From going to and fro<WH7751> in the earth<WH776>, and from walking up and down<WH1980> in it.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Satan<WH7854>, Hast thou considered<WH7760> <WH3820> my servant<WH5650> Job<WH347>, that there is none like him in the earth<WH776>, a perfect<WH8535> and an upright<WH3477> man<WH376>, one that feareth<WH3373> God<WH430>, and escheweth<WH5493> evil<WH7451>? considered: Heb. set thy heart on
Then Satan<WH7854> answered<WH6030> the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, Doth Job<WH347> fear<WH3372> God<WH430> for nought<WH2600>?

Hast not thou made an hedge<WH7753> about him, and about<WH1157> his house<WH1004>, and about all that he hath on every side<WH5439>? thou hast blessed<WH1288> the work<WH4639> of his hands<WH3027>, and his substance<WH4735> is increased<WH6555> in the land<WH776>. substance: or, cattle
But<WH199> put forth<WH7971> thine hand<WH3027> now, and touch<WH5060> all that he hath, and he will curse<WH1288> <WH3808> thee to thy face<WH6440>. and he: Heb. if he curse thee not to thy face

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Satan<WH7854>, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power<WH3027>; only upon himself put not forth<WH7971> thine hand<WH3027>. So Satan<WH7854> went forth<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>. power: Heb. hand
And there was a day<WH3117> when his sons<WH1121> and his daughters<WH1323> were eating<WH398> and drinking<WH8354> wine<WH3196> in their eldest<WH1060> brother's<WH251> house<WH1004>:
And there came<WH935> a messenger<WH4397> unto Job<WH347>, and said<WH559>, The oxen<WH1241> were plowing<WH2790>, and the asses<WH860> feeding<WH7462> beside<WH3027> them:

And the Sabeans<WH7614> fell<WH5307> upon them, and took them away<WH3947>; yea, they have slain<WH5221> the servants<WH5288> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>; and I only am escaped<WH4422> alone to tell<WH5046> thee.

While he was yet speaking<WH1696>, there came<WH935> also another, and said<WH559>, The fire<WH784> of God<WH430> is fallen<WH5307> from heaven<WH8064>, and hath burned up<WH1197> the sheep<WH6629>, and the servants<WH5288>, and consumed<WH398> them; and I only am escaped<WH4422> alone to tell<WH5046> thee. The fire: or, A great fire

While he was yet speaking<WH1696>, there came<WH935> also another, and said<WH559>, The Chaldeans<WH3778> made out<WH7760> three<WH7969> bands<WH7218>, and fell<WH6584> upon the camels<WH1581>, and have carried them away<WH3947>, yea, and slain<WH5221> the servants<WH5288> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>; and I only am escaped<WH4422> alone to tell<WH5046> thee. fell: Heb. rushed

While he was yet speaking<WH1696>, there came<WH935> also another, and said<WH559>, Thy sons<WH1121> and thy daughters<WH1323> were eating<WH398> and drinking<WH8354> wine<WH3196> in their eldest<WH1060> brother's<WH251> house<WH1004>:

And, behold, there came<WH935> a great<WH1419> wind<WH7307> from<WH5676> the wilderness<WH4057>, and smote<WH5060> the four<WH702> corners<WH6438> of the house<WH1004>, and it fell<WH5307> upon the young men<WH5288>, and they are dead<WH4191>; and I only am escaped<WH4422> alone to tell<WH5046> thee. from: Heb. from aside, etc
Then Job<WH347> arose<WH6965>, and rent<WH7167> his mantle<WH4598>, and shaved<WH1494> his head<WH7218>, and fell down<WH5307> upon the ground<WH776>, and worshipped<WH7812>, mantle: or, robe

And said<WH559>, Naked<WH6174> came I out<WH3318> of my mother's<WH517> womb<WH990>, and naked<WH6174> shall I return<WH7725> thither: the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414>, and the LORD<WH3068> hath taken away<WH3947>; blessed<WH1288> be the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>.
In all this Job<WH347> sinned<WH2398> not, nor charged<WH5414> God<WH430> foolishly<WH8604>. charged: or, attributed folly to God
